website_summaries.verdict: A top-notch ergonomic footrest that is masterfully crafted from eco-friendly rubber for exceptional quality.
pros: Boasts a textured surface that creates a kneading effect on the soles of the feet to help limit stress and enhance circulation
Easy to use right out of the box
Non-slip rubber feet prevent the footrest from slipping on all types of floor surfaces
cons: May be too short for some users
Cannot lock the footrest into a single position

customer_reviews.title: I should have bought one a long time ago
customer_reviews.text: From the first day I could tell that it was helping give my feet some relief. I have plantar fascitis and toes-up and heels-down helps keep my arch support and Achilles heel stretched and relieves some pain. I spend a lot of time at my desk and most of that time my toes have been pointed downward. I like that this support is heavy, moderately adjustable, and stays firmly where I want it to be. It came with no instructions but it probably doesn't need any (ok, maybe a warranty). I'm comfortable using it with shoes on as well as barefoot.
customer_reviews.author: DeRavenSey

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this thing! It's comfortable, has this cool rubber sole like set up on the bottom so it doesn't scrape hard word floor. I like that the actual foot stand piece can stand still or can move as needed to change position quickly. I saw some people mention their piece moves easily but I don't have that problem. I'd definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: tea710

customer_reviews.title: Good Product.
customer_reviews.text: I had another foot stool where the bottom piece could detach from the top piece. Every time I picked it up to clean the floor, it came apart. The Eureka Ergonomic Tilt Adjustable Footrest is one piece and very nicely made. Good quality and comfortable. The swivel of the top panel is tight enough that it doesn't move when you place your feet on it, unless you want it to swivel back and forth. I would purchase this product again.
customer_reviews.author: DiviLyn

customer_reviews.title: Great for someone that works at a desk all day
customer_reviews.text: I work out of my home, on the computer for 8 hours plus a day. This has helped my feet and legs feel better at the end of the day. I tend to use it barefoot, and I enjoy the texture
customer_reviews.author: Susan K. Nosotti

customer_reviews.title: so far, so good!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this after reading a lot of reviews on other Footrests. My Physical Therapist recommended a footstool to help alleviate the pressure for some pain I am having. I noticed a difference that same afternoon. I am 5'4 and I still sit comfortably, I see many complaints about that on here and folks, you may just need to adjust your seat height. Not sure about durability just yet, have only had it for 5 days, but it feels sturdy enough.
customer_reviews.author: Denisse

customer_reviews.title: good support for my feet
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty short, 5ft3, and I have my computer chair set higher than is comfortable so I need a footrest so my feet are touching the floor properly. This serves the purpose. It seems sturdy and rocks when I want it to. It moves around on the floor easily and I just use my two feet on the sides to position it. It also vacuums well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't hesitate to buy
customer_reviews.text: This is a GREAT footrest. I had previously bought a plastic one on amazon and after about a year I ended up snapping that rest clean in two. This rest has been great, I see zero durability issues with this one. One thing I did have to end up doing however is super gluing the black no slip pads on the end otherwise they just kept falling off. Short of that, best footrest I've had at my last two jobs.
customer_reviews.author: William Tell

customer_reviews.title: Works great-- very sturdy & well made
customer_reviews.text: Works great-- very sturdy & well made, I like the rocking feature, it keeps the blood flowing in your calves/feet while sitting at desk & working.
customer_reviews.author: LoveAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my feet!
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed. This footrest is perfect for resting my feet on while I work at my computer. It helps my back relax and also massages my feet while I'm working. There is plenty of leg room to fit under my keyboard which is on a pull-out shelf under my desk. I now find I can work longer and feel more relaxed when I am done. I would definitely recommend this to anyone who is on the computer a lot like I am.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Galvan

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied with Footrest
customer_reviews.text: The reason I wanted to get a footrest was because I am at a computer all day and have a tendency of putting my feet under my chair which then seems to tighten up the muscles around my knees and they start aching. With the footrest, I now will stretch out my legs. So far, I am very satisfied with this footrest. It is comfortable and being able to swivel forward and backward, I can put my feet/legs in different positions, thereby eliminating my feet being in the same spot. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: C.A. Myers

customer_reviews.title: Great value in a footrest
customer_reviews.text: bought this for under my desk at work. Had double knee replacements and this is a great product to prop up your legs. I love that it moves back and forth so you can stretch your legs out. The bottom has two small rubber feet, but they are not large enough to keep it from sliding on the carpet. I compensate for that by remembering to pull my feet off it prior to sliding my chair around. Eliminates the problem. Lightweight, no assembly required. Would recommend for this purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Helps my feet and joints
customer_reviews.text: I have an office job which means sitting for 8 hours a day. This footrest helps tremendously with joint pain and muscle fatigue. The only downside i can think of is that you cant "lock" it in a certain position/ under a certain angle.
customer_reviews.author: Anastasia Bulycheva

customer_reviews.title: Great for long hours at a desk / computer.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this. The way it tilts back and forward lets you move your feet and legs while you are sitting and helps keep you more comfortable. The surface has little bumps which also feel good on bare feet. Plus I got a new desk and have my keyboard on top of the desk now (instead of on a lower keyboard tray) and so my chair is raised up high, and this provides excellent support.
customer_reviews.author: MakeMySiteRankdotcom

customer_reviews.title: Well-crafted, sturdy and functional.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this footrest. It is well designed and sturdy. I wish I had bought it sooner. It takes the pressure off of my back and allows me to stay at the computer for longer work sessions without getting sore. It permits me to flex my feet naturally. Since it rests on carpeting, there is no slippage at all.
customer_reviews.author: Stanfx

customer_reviews.title: All metal soliid and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This door rest is made of all steel. It's heavy and has rubber feet that keep it perfectly placed on hardwood and other smooth floors. Foot bed has a rubber textured surface that feels good against your feet. Foot bed also tilts and adjusts to whatever angle feels most comfortable. This has greatly improved my comfort sitting long periods at my desk.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Deibert

customer_reviews.title: Nice and compact
customer_reviews.text: Works well! At first I was disappointed that it did not have the option of raising it higher as I have done so with another one I ordered for my mother, but it is very comfortable nonetheless. I love that it is not bulky and it's nicely compacted; for under my desk in office! I like that with my own feet I can adjust it as I desire. It does it's duty!
customer_reviews.author: Pao

customer_reviews.title: It would have been nice if you could adjust this to your liking
customer_reviews.text: Their isn't much tension so the foot rest constantly moves. It would have been nice if you could adjust this to your liking.
customer_reviews.author: cre8tive1

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: It works as intended, and I've noticed less lower back pain. I like that it moves around; I've seen that other people would like it to have a lock. As a fidgeter, I really appreciate the ability to easily adjust pressure and angle.
customer_reviews.author: B. Joyce

customer_reviews.title: sturdy but lacks height adjustment
customer_reviews.text: Six months I bought two of the Mind Reader Adjustable Height Ergonomic Foot Rests, mainly for the height adjustment. Good design but both broke within a few weeks. The notches that maintain the height are made of flimsy plastic and the slightest pressure with your feet (typically when sitting down or getting up) will break them. The Eureka unit is made of metal, and while it lacks height adjustment it looks like it will last a very long time. It swivels forward and backward and at the center setting it keeps your feet 3" off the ground. If that is enough height, buy this one and avoid the ones made of plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Decolliber

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Crap 0 stars
customer_reviews.text: This product is trash. It gets lose after only a few times of putting your feet on it. I tried multiple solutions like, tightening up the screws, adding washer,s hammering it together, and still was lose and even more lose after all the attempts to tighten it. I would only suggest this foot rest if u dont mind the foot rest constantly moving up and down . I should've returned it months ago but the process would have not even been worth it. I would give this poor product a 0 if it was an option.
customer_reviews.author: Skudz

customer_reviews.title: It worked
customer_reviews.text: Weeks into working at home, I started having knee pain from the way I was sitting in my home office, and on the basis of pure self-diagnosis, took a gamble that this might be the solution. The gamble paid off. Almost immediately, the stress and pain on my knee starting easing and has not recurred since. Not sure that my experience is generalizable to anyone else, but I no longer bend my knee under me in an unnatural position and no longer have knee pain from working at home. It worked.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great footrest without plastic. I should have bought this sooner!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great footrest for under my desk. It will deter my bad habit of sitting with my feet under my chair which is totally bad for my plantar fasciitis. After reading reviews of several different footrests, I chose this one based on the sturdy metal frame and no plastic to potentially break. It is comfortable with shoes, socks, or just bare feet with a nice rubbery platform. The width is great and it moves with ease. Since being required to work from home for 5 months, now I should have bought this a few months ago!
customer_reviews.author: Cole

customer_reviews.title: Eureka more like u-REEK-a, yuk
customer_reviews.text: Along with the fact that it is mostly metal, this looked promising: "Rubber manufacturing:meet the world’s most rigorous chemical emissions standards,to create a healthier environment for you." In fact the rubber has a VERY weird and distinctly noticeable smell. Won't be a problem to most people (I'm talking about sniffing it close-up), but if you're sensitive to chemicals or odors and were looking at this for use in a small enclosed space because of the materials claims, you might want to ignore their claims about "rigorous chemical emissions standards" and "a healthier environment" until and unless they address this and live up to that claim. Definitely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Bob H.

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when it was an Amazon deal of the day to help make my desk more ergonomic. I should have paid more for better quality because I learned quickly that it was cheaply made. When it arrived, the badge at the top of the footrest had fallen off during transit. The footrest slides the carpet floor when a small amount of horizontal pressure is applied. The metal frame is lightweight but feels cheap. I would suggest looking elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: C. Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Best footrest I have used yet
customer_reviews.text: I've been using footrests for the better part of a decade and this one surprised me out of the box. Most of the ones you find on Amazon or in an office supply store are plastic with cheap, chrome pop metal that usually break about a year or two in. I thought this is just what they do and at 20 bucks, it's not something that I get super angry about replacing. This one is a metal construction, little to no flex and it stays in place. I don't see this one cracking or snapping anytime soon. It's a great design and I'm super happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: trebor

customer_reviews.title: Great support for your body
customer_reviews.text: I've used this foot rest for one day, and the difference is very noticeable. I had been having trouble with sitting with my chair at a height sufficient for being able to comfortably type with my makeshift desk during this work at home situation, and I found it increasingly uncomfortable to sit, and it was interfering with the circulation in my lower legs. This item is a must-have for working comfortably anywhere, while supporting great circulation and posture. The tilting feature allows for instant adjustment to improve comfort. Very easy to use: take it out of the box, put it on the floor in front of you.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality rubber feet
customer_reviews.text: Over all, the foot rest is okay, it's probably better if you have carpet, but this thing needs some spikes or a larger rubberized traction device because the rubbery feet just slip right off the square metal bar shape. Basically the thing slides all over the place if you have wood floors, or even office type carpet where it's designed for office chair movement.
customer_reviews.author: Robert K

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect, except
customer_reviews.text: if you're short. This was ok when I had my chair on low so I could reach the floor without pulling on my back, but once I raised it to where it SHOULD be - even with monitor and elbows at 90 degrees to the keyboard and mouse, I could barely even reach the footrest, much less rock it like I hoped. My feet aren't even flat on it, just kind of resting my toes. I'm 5' even, if that helps in your purchase decision.
customer_reviews.author: Just me

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Working From Home!
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect addition for anyone working from home. Since using this, my legs don’t feel tired or stiff after working on my computer all day, like they used to. The position of the rest can be easily changed, and I’ve been impressed with the quality compared to other options I’ve tried in the past. The foot rest folds up nicely in case it needs to be moved as well.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Foley

customer_reviews.title: Not actually adjustable
customer_reviews.text: This item isn’t what I’d call “adjustable”. It’s just free-swiveling with no way to lock it in place. It doesn’t actually support your feet. If you watch the video you get a much better idea of what it is.
customer_reviews.author: IG

customer_reviews.title: The rubber things would just be off
customer_reviews.text: I raised my chair up to keep my arms and keyboard at the same height. This footrest is supporting my feet also allowing my feet to stretch. It's very comfortable. Just to mention, the rubber feet get out very easily when the rest is sliding on the carpet. Update: after using it for a few months, I feel like it keeps sliding forwards, which makes it not that comfortable. Even the rubber things would come off after a while.
customer_reviews.author: Yuwei

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: It was good, but not great.I was hoping to find something that was a little bit higher since I am shorter to rest my legs during the day. But it was still wasn't high enough. I'm 5-2 so if your not that short it probably won't be a problem. Also it doesn't really lock in place, it more swivels back and forth. I wanted something to be locked at an angle.
customer_reviews.author: Valatrowski

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: My feet don't touch the floor while sitting in my office chair, so this is a helpful way to rest my feet at a comfortable angle. I like it so much that I bought one for my kitchen desk, as well. It seems sturdy, and came pre-assembled.
customer_reviews.author: wgail

customer_reviews.title: Totally Satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: Finally found a foot test that isn’t flimsy or cheap. This one is a hard material and is a bit heavy. I can see this lasting and not breaking in half. I personally like the swivel effect and don’t mind at all that it doesn’t “lock” into place. That’s how my last one broke (from a different manufacturer) when trying to force it down to change the angle. No complaints totally satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small platform
customer_reviews.text: An alright idea. But the platform is tiny. If you are accustomed to sitting with your legs pressed together, you have small feet, then it may provide more comfort. I'm 5'7" with medium frame and size 10 US feet. To use it longer than 15 minutes or without slipping off the platform, I have to keep my feet close together. The resulting posture is not liberating or relaxing.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Foley

customer_reviews.title: Improvements noticed
customer_reviews.text: Since I started using this item, I have noticed a difference in my comfort at the end of a work day. My lower back feels much less stressed. It was nice that it comes pre-built as well. I removed it from the box and it was ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: t.m.

customer_reviews.title: nice  but short
customer_reviews.text: this was much closer to the ground than I expected even at the highest setting. otherwise it's easy to rock and feels good
customer_reviews.author: L. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for Good Posture and Relief of Back Pain
customer_reviews.text: I love this little footrest! Since I am at a desk all day, I'll usually twist my legs either up under or behind my chair. This is the perfect solution to maintaining good posture and not putting undue pressure on your lower back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian SLS

customer_reviews.title: Exactly What I Needed
customer_reviews.text: This was one of the first things I bought soon as I found out I was going to be working from home due to the coronavirus. This allows me to sit in my chair at its maximum height and not have my feet dangle. I like that the angle is adjustable so I can change up my foot position on occasion. I've been using it every day since the coronavirus sent people to go work from home and it's been exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: SierraDelta

customer_reviews.title: Well-beveled marvel stool of delight
customer_reviews.text: Perfect amount of tension for easy movement forward and back whilst remaining stable when you are in your preferred position. Solid metal construction and apparent durability. This foot rest is a good instance of this sort of device.
customer_reviews.author: Road Warrior

customer_reviews.title: Solid Well Built
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad footrest for desk work. Just lacks some adjustments you see on other models but its well built. It's not smooth to rock on, as I fidget when sitting at my desk. Over all not too bad though. I'll see if oil helps smooth out the rocking motion on this footrest though.
customer_reviews.author: will

customer_reviews.title: Easy to adjust and comfortable to use - edges are a bit sharp though
customer_reviews.text: Needed a solid foot rest that was adjustable and this seemed to be a near perfect solution. Only downside is the edges (corners) are a little sharp, so if the foot rest is up against the side of the desk it could dig into the surface and cause scratches - learned this the hard way. So we had to put a little tape on the corners to keep it from damaging our furniture. Otherwise no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: C. A. Rake

customer_reviews.title: Slides around on a hard floor
customer_reviews.text: I want to give this product more than 3 stars but our office floor isn't carpeted and it slides all over, so now I have to go to Home Depot to customize it.
customer_reviews.author: PS03

customer_reviews.title: Less Swelling and Pain in my legs and feet
customer_reviews.text: I like that it fits under my office desk. I can roll my feet and legs to get a stretch. I did notice that the swelling in my legs and feet was reduced significantly. Sometimes I get a weird feeling under my feet but that could be my medical condition. For the most part, I think this is a great option for people wanting to reduce leg and feet pain/swelling.
customer_reviews.author: freesia3

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Buy this if you have lower back pain. Instant relief. Our legs and feet are heavy evidently! It will take a while to get out of the habit of crossing your legs (we do this to help one side of our backs). But from research I’ve done, crossing your legs while sitting can worsen low back pain. Anyway, I love this stool and am glad I didn’t buy the more expensive ones I looked at.
customer_reviews.author: 501 jellybean

customer_reviews.title: Not Wide Enough
customer_reviews.text: Not saying this product is bad, however it wasn't comfortable for me. I have since purchased star tech foot rest which is wider, i do recommend that brand. As for this one, i don't feel the comfort was there, needs to be improved. It is sturdy and supports weight, just needs to be wider. Hope that helps.
customer_reviews.author: Trusted Friend

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and works well
customer_reviews.text: This is the second footrest I've purchased for my office and I do like the way this one rotates and (mostly) stays put without constantly moving around with every tiny movement that I make. However, mine sits on a thick rug and the rubber feet had to be glued on as they kept coming off whenever I moved it around without picking it completely up.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila

customer_reviews.title: not a carpet friendly..
customer_reviews.text: I am using it due to work from home status and it has to be on the carpet. it's being pushed when I comfortably rest my feet on them... I always have to be careful so that it doesn't get pushed away.. I tried it again in my dining table where it's not carpeted and worked great. that 2 stars missing for perfect rating is because it's moving around on the carpet surface. i think design and comfort level is good, tho --> 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kim

customer_reviews.title: nice and sturdy- does the job!
customer_reviews.text: The item was well packaged and arrived on time. It provides nice support for my feet which don't quite reach the floor when sitting in my chair. I am very pleased with the quality and functionality of the product.
customer_reviews.author: js

customer_reviews.title: Wish the swivel was more sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Slides too easily on tile thus making it uncomfortable. The swivel moves so rapidly it’s kind of uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: SABRINA LOPEZ

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a footrest because of moderate lower back pain. This device was reasonably priced and seemed to fit my need. I like it and would certainly recommend it to others. I do have one, possibly irrelevant, usage note. I found it far more convenient to position the footrest with the label to the back instead of the front. This was more stable due to the plastic mat I use under my chair.
customer_reviews.author: LRW

customer_reviews.title: do not feel the benefit yet
customer_reviews.text: I put it under my work desk and I did not feel much benefit for many months usage. It is very light and moving around if my feet touch it a bit. Not much support. I use it for stretch my ankle back and forth but the not steadiness make it not a premium tool to work out and the angle is not enough.
customer_reviews.author: sally the real buyer

customer_reviews.title: It ain’t pretty but it works!
customer_reviews.text: A work from home must have for short people. It flexes forward and back easy to adjust to whatever foot angle you prefer. My feet would always fall asleep before because I’m shorter and my feet would dangle in the chair. What a difference this makes. Should have bought it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: emily

customer_reviews.title: Very good, could use some upgrades
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and well built footrest. It has a good solid weight and is like a large pedal. The angle is changed with foot pressure. Because the adjustments are loose without any resistance, there are 3 basic positions; up, down, and floating. Some features I would have liked to have seen: 1. Spring tension to push back on the plate 2. Tilt-lock with a pin. I would buy again if an improved version came out.
customer_reviews.author: Tobin A.

customer_reviews.title: Relieves Pressure on Back
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for use at the office. Mission accomplished. Takes pressure off your back and helps to reduce swelling in your feet and legs. If you have short legs, it Keeps your feet from dangling.
customer_reviews.author: Teri Carr

customer_reviews.title: Needs to be able to lock into position
customer_reviews.text: I think I would be able to give 5 stars if it didn't move all the time. I need to be able to set it to the position I want and lock it in. It rocks back and forth and is so aggravating. I'm still trying to make it work but I'm afraid I've wasted my money because I won't be able to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: STATIONARY
customer_reviews.text: NEEDED THIS FOR MY STRESSFUL SECURITY JOB AT THE TIME IN SAN FRAN. IT DID THE JOB... ALTHOUGH MY DESK WAS HUGE SO IT WASN'T NEEDED BECAUSE I HAD TO MOVE AROUND ALOT. IM GLAD ITS OVER NOW. THIS PRODUCT IS GOOD IF YOU ARE SITTING ALL-DAY. NOT MOVING ALL THE TIME.
customer_reviews.author: Alex awadalla

customer_reviews.title: It's workable
customer_reviews.text: It tilts back and forth which is a great feature. It is sturdy as well and fits perfectly. The only issues would be if it had an adjustable height!
customer_reviews.author: AlphaO

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: For the price I wasn't sure if this was just going to be a cheap piece of plastic or not. This is high quality footrest and I love that it actually tilts both directions. Also when tightened it does stay in place very well. would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kara S. Smith

customer_reviews.title: I Found It!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried three different foot rests for the passenger side of our new car. As they say, the third time is the charm! And the name of this foot rest, EUREKA, from the Greek, "I found (it)," is perfect! It works perfectly in our Ford Fusion!
customer_reviews.author: SS

customer_reviews.title: No Tilt Issue
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my lower back and sciatica issue but unfortunately the tilt was damaged, Did not realize for some time and then had to return it, Bought this solely based on reviews and I would be careful with it
customer_reviews.author: Drishti trivedi

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Effective Footrest
customer_reviews.text: This is a finely crafted footrest--all steel with a rubber covering over the footplate that flexes just right. For the price, this one us unbeatable.
customer_reviews.author: SMS

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love it for my desk where I spend long hours
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for someone else - tried it myself and kept it! Absolutely love it for my desk where I spend long hours. Helped relieve physical issues from sitting all day in the same position.
customer_reviews.author: Monica Case

customer_reviews.title: Great after surgery
customer_reviews.text: I used to have a wooden one, but it broke. I’m really short and my feet don’t touch the floor. Had a hip replacement and I did place a chair cushion on it as it made me more comfortable. Now I don’t need it. My feet don’t slip on it.
customer_reviews.author: K9lz

customer_reviews.title: pleased
customer_reviews.text: I was so surprised that the footrest takes so much pressure off my legs my. I'm at the computer quite a bit and at my sewing machine even more. Now I can sit much longer. I would recommend this for anyone that has to be seated for any length of time.
customer_reviews.author: griggs

customer_reviews.title: Very good footrest
customer_reviews.text: Very good product. It's comfortable enough that I will now always use it Deducting one star because Amazon's basic footrest looks identical and is cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: B. Doolittle

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: Once you decide on an angle, there is nothing that holds it there. It just swings back and forth when your weight is on it. It doesn't stay very still on the floor either, it's always sliding around. It's pretty much useless.
customer_reviews.author: Kirsten Staalesen

customer_reviews.title: It's Solid
customer_reviews.text: It's solid but, there's no way to lock the tilt on it. It also slides away from me on my carpet over time so, I have to keep re-adjusting it on the floor. That being said, it's still probably one of the best available on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Double D

customer_reviews.title: This is the one to buy!
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of reviews for similar products before selecting this one. I'm glad I selected this one. It feels durable, and the mechanics seem smooth in the motion as I tilt it underfoot. I wish it had true "roller balls" for massage, but the bumps do feel nice. It makes a much bigger difference in the ergonomics of my workspace than I ever would have expected.
customer_reviews.author: Bell

customer_reviews.title: Works and pivots nicely.
customer_reviews.text: I'm an average height guy with an above average height desk. This does the job but I do wish it was 2 inches higher for my non standard height desk. I did fix the problem by retrofitting cuts of spare lumber to the base.

customer_reviews.title: very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: this is very comfortable. I like that it moves when you want it to move (rocking) with your feet,and will stay in whatever position you want it in. It doesn't roll around while you feet are on it. I didn't give any stars for pain relief, as I didn't have any pain so I felt I couldn't rate that.
customer_reviews.author: Gina Blanton

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this foot rest. My last footrest was plastic and it broke after about a year of use. This footrest is sturdy metal and seems to be quite durable. It tilts freely, which I was not sure I would like, but it seems to be fine.
customer_reviews.author: SG

customer_reviews.title: GREAT FOR LEGS AND FEET
customer_reviews.text: I really needed this to get movement on my legs and it rocks awesome back and forth too, the BIG PLUS is that it is a smooth rubberized nodules, very comfortable even on bare feet, not those other cheap plastic ones, highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Geri

customer_reviews.title: A perfect footrest!
customer_reviews.text: i am glad i found this little chap!! Working from home and needed some kind of footrest- came across this and ordered it. Delivery was fast and smooth. i love this footrest.Its perfect for my short legs!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for under my desk at work!
customer_reviews.text: I love this footrest! I use it at work under my computer desk and it makes such a difference on my legs. It allows you to move your ankles and stretch your lower legs. You don't think about it until you use it and realize how helpful it is so that your joints don't stiffen during the workday. Thanks!!
customer_reviews.author: R.D.N.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice angle for my feet
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad I purchased this adjustable footrest. I have been wanting something for a long time. This design is very nice. I enjoy having it under my desk very much.
customer_reviews.author: Prime Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fully assembled, light, and helps with back pain
customer_reviews.text: Love this! I used it at work and it takes pressure off my back and keeps my jumpy legs comfortable because it swivels back and forth. Other reviews said they had issues assembling it, mine was fully together. Just had to take it out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Bloom

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: The only complaint I have is that it doesn't have very good traction, so I constantly have to readjust it. It would also be nice if you could lock it in place. It works like a charm and is heavy-duty enough I can imagine it lasting a long time but isn't bulky or unmanageable.
customer_reviews.author: Sirwin

customer_reviews.title: Large, sturdy base
customer_reviews.text: Swivels up and down, rubber pegs on the ends keep it from sliding across the floor. Only flaw is it's a bit too short, wish it were a little higher so I could recline back into my chair
customer_reviews.author: Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great for ergonomics.
customer_reviews.text: For proper 90 degree elbow angle using my laptop on my desk, I had to raise my computer chair up to a higher setting. It left my heels off the ground, so I tried this. It's nice, The 5 3/16" height is only for the back. I wish it came with a booster pad t lift the whole thing up another 2".
customer_reviews.author: Magical Dragon

customer_reviews.title: This Footrest is OK
customer_reviews.text: It's comfortable and seems pretty sturdy, but it sure would be nice if there was a way to adjust the height. That said, it generally does what the manufacturer says it will do, so I'll be keeping it.
customer_reviews.author: SSG

customer_reviews.title: Too adjustable
customer_reviews.text: It's adjustable, but that means that its always sliding around. There's no way to fix a height setting.
customer_reviews.author: lychees123

customer_reviews.title: Surdy product, but it slides around
customer_reviews.text: This product slides on my hardwood floors, the floor grips do no owrk. It is very comfortable on my feet when it is not sliding around..
customer_reviews.author: Nikky2

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I just needed a lift for my feet when I'm watching TV or to do a pedicure. The tilt angles are perfect and it keeps my felt elevated and comfortable. Really outstanding quality. Now my husband wants one.
customer_reviews.author: Tony L

customer_reviews.title: Not stable. Poor feet support
customer_reviews.text: This item is not that great nor stable. The bottom feet part keeps coming off and I couldn’t put my feet on these as it moves too much
customer_reviews.author: Jason Dizon

customer_reviews.title: Heavy but great quality! Perfect for poor circulation
customer_reviews.text: Definitely worth the purchase! I use this for work since my job is sedentary 90% of the day. Helps with my circulation. It's heavy for my taste but it's great quality!
customer_reviews.author: meshae gracian

customer_reviews.title: Well made, sturdy, the right height.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this on the recommendation of an occupational therapist for my teen. She loves using it and when sitting for longer periods of time (doing schoolwork) it helps her with posture. It's hard for her to sit still but this works for fidgeting too. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: It moves
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this specifically for the tilt factor and it did not disappoint. I actually find myself extending, stretching, and exercising my ankles and feet. I really like it a lot. So much less pain than propping my feet up on a square. I wish the height were adjustable as well, but it is not, and that is not even a complaint. I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: Great for use with food pedal
customer_reviews.text: I am using this in my medical transcription job. It has alleviated a lot of leg pain and problems I was having as a result of restless legs. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use in our car but actually, I use it every day at home! It keeps my blood moving and gives me a perfect excuse to fidget!
customer_reviews.author: worship2AbbaFather

customer_reviews.title: Perfect except not wide enough.
customer_reviews.text: If you're a bigger dude it's not wide enough to accommodate a good size man spread. If it was just 2-6 inches wider it would be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: 4d4m

customer_reviews.title: Its good for those of us who need to move while sitting
customer_reviews.text: It moves easily with a foot push so it is good for those of us who need to move while needing to sit. I would have liked it to be a little higher, but I do like it anyway.
customer_reviews.author: S Connor

customer_reviews.title: Great for good circulation while sitting
customer_reviews.text: Great for good circulation while sitting. I stopped using it for a few days and realized how much it was helping my legs from swelling due to sitting.
customer_reviews.author: Mindy

customer_reviews.title: Decent product
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty well made product. I like the fact that the angle is adjustable and it has a non slip surface. I gave it 4 stars only because it wasn't tall enough for me. I'm short and there just wasn't enough height for me to be comfortable. Otherwise great product.
customer_reviews.author: luvtoknit

customer_reviews.title: Excellent footrest for working at desk
customer_reviews.text: Does the job perfectly, and seems to be sturdily built. Only downside is the rubber guards on the legs keep slipping off - I had to superglue them so they'd stay on.
customer_reviews.author: Vasily

customer_reviews.title: Rough surface treads- must use with shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Very rough surface makes it useless with docked feet. You must wear shoes whenever you use this. Very durable if that works for you.
customer_reviews.author: E. Rose

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable to use.
customer_reviews.text: I got this to use at work. It's comfortable but I wish it sat a little higher. When it arrived, it was missing a screw and needed to be repaired before it could be used. (It wasn't just loose, it was actually missing.) That being said, I do like the product.
customer_reviews.author: DHS

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Written by Mrs. C: Works well to give my legs the proper amount of elevation which keeps them from falling asleep while I'm at the computer.
customer_reviews.author: William C

customer_reviews.title: Tilting Adjustable Footrest
customer_reviews.text: Got this for long car trips, but am using it at home as well. I have leg circulation problems and this really helps lift my legs a bit from the chair so that leg veins are not compressed.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome foot rest for under a desk. It is very strong and you don’t have to manually adjust it!
customer_reviews.author: Skylar Fleming

product_meta.title: Eureka Ergonomic Tilt Adjustable Footrest with Massage Surface Under Desk, Black & Gray
feature_bullets: Ergonomic design：adjustable and comfortable angle to support your legs.
Flat texture design：massage foot to release your pressure.
Floating adjustment：0-20 ° stretch the legs to promote blood circulation.
Scratch-resistant：Scratch proof rubber feet prevent the floor from being scratched and protect your feet.
Rubber manufacturing：meet the world’s most rigorous chemical emissions standards,to create a healthier environment for you.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars888 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
